results.title: Letters home
results.brief_description: Sue’s great grandfather, Elisha Morgan, fought in the American Civil War but today all the family has left are three photographs, some letters, an obituary and a sword.

results.title: Just us
results.brief_description: Karli and Elmo grew up together. They went to the same schools, shared good times and bad times, and when things went wrong, there was always each other.

results.title: Inside outside...inside out
results.brief_description: Kristie remembers her childhood and teenage years as unhappy ones, of abuse and internal struggle. But at age 19, her life began to turn around through three very special people - Linda, Liz and Penny.

results.title: The Garden of roses
results.brief_description: At Geelong Hospital there is a garden of peace, opened in 2001, to commemorate all medical staff who have served their country in war and peace. This is Ted’s story (a Korean veteran) of his involvement and pride in being associated with this special garden of reflection and remembrance.

results.title: Asphalt children...to all Sarajevians
results.brief_description: Vedrana is proud to be Yugoslavian, and proud to have been born in Sarajeva. To background images of Sarajeva, Vedrana reminisces about her childhood and growing up in the days of Tito - of her absolute belief in Yugoslavia where nationality did not matter. She asks “How could 1992 happen to Sarajeva, the most tolerant city in the world?”

results.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. Vol. 2
results.brief_description:
Western Stories: Expressions for the Future is an inspirational collection of works from young people who, through their association with the Western Chances program, have been given the opportunity to tell their stories and build their own bridge to the future.
Western Chances was established to ensure that financial hardship does not prevent a young person in Melbourne’s West from achieving their maximum potential in life.
